thread.title: Domino's Creates Its Own Delivery Car With GM, Google Partner - Bloomberg Business
thread.title_full: Domino's Creates Its Own Delivery Car With GM, Google Partner - Bloomberg Business

author: yahoo
title: Domino's Creates Its Own Delivery Car With GM, Google Partner - Bloomberg Business
text:
Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on WhatsApp Share on LinkedIn Share on Reddit Share on Google+ E-mail Share on Twitter Share on WhatsApp Domino’s Pizza Inc., facing stiff competition and more demanding customers, is working with General Motors Co. to build its own fleet of custom delivery cars.
The company is rolling out 100 test vehicles emblazoned with the Domino’s logo and red-and-blue colors, as well as an oven in the rear that can keep pizzas warm during transit. Domino’s plans to bring the cars to 25 markets, including Boston, Dallas, Detroit, Houston, New Orleans and Seattle, according to a statement Wednesday.
Domino’s, the second-largest U.S. pizza company, is attempting to stay ahead of a fast-food industry where delivery is increasingly the norm. McDonald’s Corp., Taco Bell, Burger King and Starbucks Corp. are all experimenting with delivery services, bringing more competition to pizza chains. Though the modified-car program remains small, the idea is to use technology and custom features to give drivers an edge -- as well as creating a marketing tool that can roam city streets.
